Intensive outpatient (IOP): an intensive outpatient program, or IOP, doesn't require living at a facility. However, it demands more time and attention than a regular outpatient program. Think of an IOP as a bridge between inpatient rehab and outpatient therapy.
Outpatient: Outpatient programs tend to be several days a week of group or individual  therapy, recreational activities, and more. They are often the last step after you have completed the other levels of care, and have no residential requirements.
